answers.answer: Information on train routes, timetables, and ticket purchasing for passenger trains between main cities in Romania is available from major railway operators. You can also find international train tickets.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Transport Train info'.

answers.answer: Visitors are recommended not to hail a cab but to use ride-hailing apps like Free Now, Uber, or Bolt, which are available in English and cover all major cities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Taxi'.

answers.answer: Most shops are generally open from 9 or 10 am to 6 or 8 pm on weekdays, while shopping malls are usually open from 9 am to 10 pm. Many offices, especially for flights, visas, or car rental, are closed by 4 pm.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Opening hours'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian children suffering from cancer can be directed to national cancer treatment centers via a platform developed by the Dăruiește Aripi Association and the Romanian Pediatric Oncology and Hematology Society. Support can be accessed by filling out a form, emailing ukrainechildcancer@daruiestearipi.ro, or calling +40724024229.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: The National Alliance for Rare Diseases Romania, in collaboration with EURORDIS, can provide support and guidance to refugees with rare diseases. Additionally, the NoRo center in Zalău offers free therapy for Ukrainian children, with contact details provided for assistance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.

answers.answer: The main mobile phone providers in Romania are Orange, Telekom, and Vodafone. A local SIM card can be purchased from any of these providers for typically €5 and topped up by voucher from phone shops or street kiosks.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Telecommunications Phones'.

answers.answer: The currency of Romania is the Romanian leu (RON). Ukrainian hryvnia (UAH) can be exchanged for RON at BCR (Romanian Commercial Bank) at the BNR exchange rate, up to 1,000 lei per person with a Ukrainian passport.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: BCR offers zero costs for transactions made at POS and ATMs with cards issued in Ukraine, zero commission for opening and administering a current account, and zero fees for inter and intra bank payments for individuals with Ukrainian passports.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Money'.

answers.answer: A Ukrainian refugee should say, ”Salut. Sunt refugiat din Ucraina. Nu vorbesc română.” or ”Hello. I am an Ukrainian refugee. I do not speak Romanian.”
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Useful contacts 112 Emergency Number'.

answers.answer: Individuals can request or offer resources such as food, products, clothing, tents, transportation, or volunteers by accessing the "Request or provide resources" link under the Sprijin de Urgență platform.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: The Un Acoperiș platform offers support for finding temporary accommodation for vulnerable people arriving in Romania, and also allows individuals to offer a space for accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: Travelers with disabilities typically encounter challenges with inaccessible public transport and the unavailability of cars with hand controls from rental companies in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Travelers with disabilities'.

answers.answer: The legal public holidays for 2023 in Romania include New Year (Jan 1, 2), Day of Unification (Jan 24), Orthodox Easter (Apr 22, 24-25), Labor Day (May 1), Children's Day (June 1), Orthodox Pentecost (June 12, 13), Assumption (Aug 15), Saint Andrew (Nov 30), Romania's National Day (Dec 1), and Christmas (Dec 25, 26).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Opening hours'.

answers.answer: Contact details including addresses, phone numbers, fax numbers, and email addresses are provided for Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers in locations such as Rădăuți, Maramureș, Galați, București, Timișoara, and Giurgiu.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Regional Centers for Procedures and Accommodation for Asylum Seekers'.

answers.answer: People from Ukraine needing HIV treatment or services can contact Sens Positiv via Facebook, Instagram (@informathiv.ro), or phone at 0744.682.225. They, along with partners, will also refer and accompany individuals to official HIV Focal Points.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania and read the section under 'Health'.
